p:
Extractions at low pressures and temperatures are attractive from an economic standpoint, giving high yield in short extraction time, hence reducing costs (
13 ). In the same work extraction of coriander seed oil using propane as a solvent, under supercritical and subcritical conditions, using 2·10 7 and 3·10 7 Pa at 35 °C for CO 2 and 5·10 6, 8·10 6 and 10 7 Pa at 25 °C for propane indicated that propane solvation power was much higher than CO 2 (
13 ).
